title: Development of Mathematical and Computational Models for Predicting Agricultural Soil–Water Management Properties
abstract: Introduces computational models to predict soil-water properties for improved irrigation scheduling across diverse soil types.

title: A Machine Learning Approach to Optimize the Water Consumption for Irrigation of Rice Crop
abstract: Proposes a predictive XGBoost model to optimise irrigation schedules based on rainfall prediction and water consumption patterns.

title: AI-Driven Optimization of Agricultural Water Management for Sustainable Food Production
abstract: Combines AI and remote sensing to predict soil moisture and optimise irrigation for improved water efficiency.

title: Enhancing Irrigation Management: Unsupervised Machine Learning Approaches
abstract: Uses unsupervised ML techniques to analyse large geophysical datasets and optimise irrigation management strategies.

title: Application of Machine Learning Approaches in Supporting Irrigation Scheduling
abstract: Reviews 16 studies using ML for irrigation scheduling and compares their data inputs, algorithms, and outcomes.

title: Precision Irrigation Management Using Machine Learning and Digital Farming Solutions
abstract: Presents an ML-driven digital platform integrating weather and sensor data to optimise irrigation decisions in agriculture.

title: Artificial Intelligence to Optimize Water Consumption in Agriculture
abstract: Introduces a three-layer AI system for irrigation water savings, combining predictive modelling and real-time decision-making.

title: Integrating Artificial Intelligence into an Automated Irrigation System
abstract: Describes an AI-driven irrigation system using real-time sensor data to optimise water use for rice and tomato crops.

title: Optimizing Irrigation Efficiency Using Deep Reinforcement Learning in the Field
abstract: Proposes Deep RL-based Irrigation Control (DRLIC) to reduce irrigation water while maintaining crop yields.

title: Knowledge-Based Optimal Irrigation Scheduling of Agro-Hydrological Systems
abstract: Presents an MPC framework that predicts future water requirements to optimise irrigation timing in complex field environments.
